I've been working on a fetcher for Heritrix that uses jCIFS 
(http://jcifs.samba.org/) to crawl network drives.  jCIFS uses URIs 
that have a username and password included, separated by a colon, like 
this: 'smb://name:password@.../'.  When I put a URL like this 
in as a seed, however, the crawler hangs, and the seeds report shows 
the crawler as using the seed: 'smb://name/', basically truncating it 
at the colon.  In testing this, I noticed that it does the same thing 
for http urls that use the same format for username and password.  I'm 
not sure if this problem is in the UURI class or somewhere else in the 
Heritrix code.  I'd try escaping the colon, but I believe jCIFS treats 
escaped colons differently to allow colons to be used in passwords.  
Any suggestions?

Xavid Pretzer
